fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3976].
  {panel}

Enable the ability to create different reports. People should be able to create a jar file that contains the necessary class implemenations, etc to generate a custom report. Need to investigate if reports should become velocity templates or if the jar can contain jsps?

Comment from Scott:

.... Perhaps if people package an actions.xml inside their jar, we can load it alongside the normal webwork actions?

Maybe we could make a standard plugin.xml file that has:

<plugin>
services?
listeners?
actions?
actions.xml files?
class implementations?
</plugin>

Then people can have just one XML file to configure, for all their plugin needs?
fields.summary: Enable ability to generate different reports

The following affects Confluence and JIRA alike:
If I enter an umlaut character in Quick Search, like "ä" I get "Ã¤" in the resulting search result page (Confluence). In Jira I get an "Ã¼".
I also get zero hits (both in Confluence and in JIRA)
Eg. in Confluence we go a user called "Martin Küpperbusch". I don't get a hit when I search for "küpperbusch" - but I get one when searching für "K?pperbusch".

fields.description:
after opening a new issue and sending the first email ("Created: xxx"), it will be nice that subsequent messages ("Commented:xxx", "Updated:xxx", "Closed:xxx", ...) could retain a reference to the first message, so that emails can be easily grouped in threads by email clients and mailing list managers (and google gmail).

This can be easily done adding the headers
  In-Reply-To: (message id)
  References: (previous messages list)
to messages
fields.summary: add "in replay to" headers to messages related to the same bug

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to select as default assignee either "Unassigned", or "Project Lead" (more in the Enterprise version).

It would be nice to be able to set "Current User", i.e. the creator of an issue, as the default assignee.

We have a lot of small teams using JIRA, with a large volumne of issues, and they would have benefit of this option - as they currently have to select themselves as assignee, each time they create an issue.

(and the list of possible assignees is rather long as the issue may have to be routed to any of the other 300 employees in our company)
fields.summary: New default assignee; creator of the issue

fields.description:
To illustrate the problem, - proceed with the following steps:

1) In the Administration area, click to expand the "Import & Export" list.
2) Choose Backup Data to XML link.
3) Type in an file name on the C drive, and proceed to do the backup.
4) On the first page that is returned, Click to expand the "Options & Settings" list...

The page refreshes, -recalling the last action.  (The database export action is therefor recalled.)  As the filename specified is no longer in scope, the database export is redone this time to a textarea onscreen.

This is an artifact of the web framework, - but there must be a clean way to resolve this.  

Some different approaches to a fix:

1) Some simple W3C compliant DHTML could be written to handle the expansion and contraction of the links without requiring a page refresh.  
2) After a successful action the page could forward on to a success page view, that if re-requested, simply refreshed the view without re-requesting the previous action.
3) The pre-written hrefs used in the links that cause the expansion and contraction could include an additional parameter notifying the server that the action should not be re-processed and a blank administration screen should be returned.
fields.summary: In Administration area, when clicking to expand an item in the left hand menu, previous action should not be recalled.

fields.description:
I18N characters are not displayed correctly in excel view running on Weblogic 8.1. The chracters are replaced with 'question marks'.

JIRA standalone (Tomcat 4) produces an excel view with these characters displayed correctly - so the encoding is correctly set.

Weblogic incorrectly handles the encoding as set on the page for content of type 'application/vnd.ms-excel'.

The attached files indicate the issue - issue 'TP-999' contains Chinese characters that are displayed/encoded correctly when viewed as 'text/html'. The excel files are not encoded correctly showing these characters as question marks.
fields.summary: I18N characters displayed incorrectly in Excel view with Weblogic 8.1

fields.description:
From Arne Shirmacher:

We have made a new language_de_DE.jar file with all entries translated into german. The download link and instructions how to include the jar file in the application is here:

 http://www.softwaretesting.de/article/view/90/1/11/


We should update JIRA with this version, and send him updates before JIRA 2.7 is released.
fields.summary: Updated German translation available

fields.description:
One user id, one password, one audit trail would be great for JIRA by supporting Wedgetail JCSI SSO.

I think JIRA uses OSUser or Seraph for the user authentication and maybe authorization. A corporation between Atlassian and Wedgetail will benefit both products. I can make an initial contact for you!

A result should be a best practice document "Wedgetail JCSI SSO integration in Atlassian JIRA".

Links:
------
http://www.wedgetail.com/jcsi/sso/index.html

http://www.opensymphony.com/osuser/
http://opensource.atlassian.com/seraph/

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=5621&tstart=0
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3912
fields.summary: Support Wedgetail JCSI SSO (Single Sign-On)

fields.description: When viewing the Assigned Issues portlet the order changes when the priorities are not unique.
fields.summary: Assigneed Issue are not in consistant order
Full content comments to now show time

fields.description:
Hello. 

A user got an email from jira with the following:

SUBJECT: DELIVERY FAILURE: Operation stopped at your request
Your message

 Subject: [JIRA] Commented: (XX-XXX) XXXXXX XXXX XXXXX Request

was not delivered to:

 XXXXX.XXXXXX@XXXX.com

because:

 Operation stopped at your request

What does this mean?
fields.summary: Operation stopped at your request
It should be possible to configure what issues statuses Jira considers as "open".

fields.description: Update "Add Project" description for project key to use warning defined in properties file - if it exists.
fields.summary: Change "Add Project" description for project key

fields.description: Enable logging & profiling to be configured from within JIRA itself, without having to edit property files.
fields.summary: Configure Logging from within JIRA

fields.description:
It would be uber-cool if JIRA were able to be integrated with Perforce (http://www.perforce.com/), an alternative VCS system, or at least with Perforce Jobs (see http://www.perforce.com/perforce/products/defecttracking.html ). There is an integration library available from Perforce ( http://www.perforce.com/perforce/products/p4dti.html ) -- maybe you can use it. We use Perforce in-house, and if JIRA would be supporting the Job tracking features, we would buy it in a snap.

Thanks for considering!
fields.summary: Implement Perforce+PerforceJobs integration

fields.description:
My company is interested in using JIRA to host an on-site knowledge base. We created a custom "Information" issue type with priority "N/A", but it would be convenient if this issue type only showed up in the Knowldedge Base project. Even when the information does show up, it still has some fields that aren't needed for the project, like assigned to. 
   The ability to customize which fields appear and don't appear on a project by project basis would be especially useful
fields.summary: Project by Project Field Customization

fields.description:
When viewing the road map for Confluence at http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10470&report=roadmap
there are two unresolved issues at the moment. However progress bar says that "(39 of 40 issues have been resolved)".
fields.summary: Release progress is shown incorrrectly

fields.description:
I have installed JIRA (2.6.1 Trial) Standalone on Windows 2000 professional

Tomcat(built in): 4.1.29
JDK: 1.4.2.04
Database: SQL Server 2000

It succeeded in initializing and populating the database. But when i using it, there was an error with message:

>>>Error in creating GenricValue: [SQL][SQL Server 2000]Underlying input stream returned zero bytes.

And i can't create, search, backup...............................

I have re-installed jira and db several times....

Can anybody help me? Thanks very much
fields.summary: Error in SQL Server 2000

fields.description: Jira currently supports integration with CVS repositories.  Since Subversion 1.0 has been released and is a likely next step for may long time CVS users, Jira should support Subversion repositories.
fields.summary: Add support for Subversion to Jira

fields.description:
We are using JIRA to a wider extent . The usage is bound to increase in the future . We would like to know whether the following features will be supported by JIRA and if so how ?
1. Is there a possibility to move the closed projects out to a different repository. This we would like to do if the issue is closed and remain closed for specific number of days(say 1-2 months). This we need because the no of closed issues are increasing more in number.
2. Will it be possible to move stale /unwanted projects out of the repository. Same is the case with users(Removing users out of the system who no longer exist?)

Your suggestions invited pls

Regards
Bharath N.S.
fields.summary: Maintenance of Jira in Largely used systems

fields.description:
I've imported some issues using the CSV importer, but no actions are available on the issue detail page.  There's a stack trace indicating a problem determining the available workflow actions on the console when I try to view the issue.

I have added a step to my workflow, but it works fine for any issues I create from within JIRA, so I don't know if it's a factor in this problem.
fields.summary: invalid state for imported issues - no workflow action available

fields.description: Frequently our workflow doesn't have a specific user associated with it but rather a department.  It would be nice to be able to assign an issue to a group, who would then have it show up in their workflows.
fields.summary: Assign an issue to a group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3937].
  {panel}

It would be great to have more information and control associated with versions.  For example:
 * A real workflow for versions -- including stages, who's working on them, their location in the repository, and the release status.
 * Release dates as a seperate piece of information.  Release notes are great but I would like to quickly see when a version was publically released.
 * Associate this version workflow status with the issues that are fixed in that version
fields.summary: Associate more information and a workflow with versions
Daily email digest of changes

fields.description:
We would like to be able to search for issues within a subset of projects.

I can think of two ways of implementing this:
 (1) Add the ability to search all but exclude certain projects, or to include only particular projects
 (2) Group projects, and allow searching within groups of projects.

I realize you'd loose custom fields when looking across projects where some have the fields and some don't, but it's more important for us to be able to look for all issues in several projects.  (maybe the custom fields that are common across selected projects could be displayed?)
fields.summary: Exclude project or filter groups of projects
Add custom headers to email notifications

fields.description:
We'd like an action on each issue to mail the issue to a user, without reassigning the issue, with a note attached to the issue.  It would be great if there was an option to append this note as a comment on the issue, as in:

"Mailed to <user> on <date>

<note>"

Frequently we just want to alert someone to the pressence of an issue or gently remind them to look at it again, without requiring them to watch or assign the issue.
fields.summary: Function to mail an issue to an arbitrary user

fields.description:
We'd like to have an option to add users to the watch list when they comment on an issue.

Currently, users frequently forget to watch so they don't get any additional notifications about an issue, breaking the continuity of the workflow.
fields.summary: Add a user to the watchlist when they comment on an issue

fields.description:
Get this error when I try to resolve or stop progress on any of my issues

# Form Errors:  Could not move to history step for #10002: root cause: Generic Entity Exception occurred in deleteByAnd (SQL Exception while executing the following:DELETE FROM OS_CURRENTSTEP WHERE ID=? ([Microsoft][SQLServer 2000 Driver for JDBC]Connection reset by peer: socket write error))
fields.summary: Can't resolve or stop progress on issues

fields.description:
When viewing the RSS feed for a single item, i.e.

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/INTPLUG-62?view=rss&decorator=none

The feed item isn't inside a <channel></channel> element so a standard reader fails to find items.
fields.summary: Viewing single issue RSS doesn't contain a channel

fields.description:
If a project member updates the summary of an issue, the assignee receives a notification message like any other update to the issue. However the Change History of the issue is unclear about what has changed about the issue. This can result in the assignee trying to find out what has changed in the issue. Which is a bit unnecessary with such a minor change.
This situation could be prevented by a less ambiguous notification mail and Change History.
fields.summary: Changing the summary of an issue results in a unclear notification message

fields.description:
The "Due Date - From/To" date picker in issue navigator is broken.

Clicking on the calendar icon has no effect.
fields.summary: "Due Date - From/To" date picker in issue navigator is broken.
Document DB2/WebSphere installation

fields.description: Currently there is no way to notify the 'leads' of each component identified in an issue. It would be nice to have the ability to create a notification type for this where if two different component were selected by the user when the issue was created both component owners would get a notification.
fields.summary: Add notification type for component leads

fields.description:
Currently you cannot create a filter that shows you all issues that are linked to issues in a current state. Nor can you create a filter that shows you all issues with links of a particular type.
It would be useful to create a filter that showed all issues that were 'blocking' other issues - that is, all issues that were preventing issues from closing.
fields.summary: Enable filtering by linked issues, show dependent issues

fields.description:
The following entities should be internationalized:

Internationalize issue types, resolutions, statuses and priorities.
fields.summary: Internationalize issue types, resolutions, statuses and priorities

fields.description: Release note templates are not internationlized.
fields.summary: Internationalize Release Note templates

However, clicking on the XML view of the list (which currently shows 9 items in the normal JIRA view) will dump ALL unresolved issues assigned to any member of the group.

The filter summary in question is:

Resolution: Unresolved
Due before: 5 days from now
Assignee in group: TechOps
Sorted by: Updated descending 

and the XML/RSS URL produced is:

https://[undisclosed]/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&assignee=TechOps&assigneeSelect=specificgroup&resolutionIds=-1&sorter/field=updated&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=25&reset=true&decorator=none

fields.description:
The problem is that JIRA "resolves" the "Automatic" assignee before it checks for mandatory fields.

So if the Components field has been set mandatory, and the component leads have been nominated, and the user creates an issue without selecting a component, JIRA resolves the "Automatic" assignee as if no components have been selected (e.g. to the Project Lead). Then JIRA validates all mandatory fields, detects that components have not been selected and returns the error page. Unfortunately the assignee already has been resolved, so the Assignee drop down has e.g. project lead selected, rather than "Automatic". The user needs to manually set the assignee to "Automatic" again (as well as select the component), to get the issue assigned to the right component lead.
fields.summary: JIRA does not select component lead as assignee properly

fields.description:
attached is some code to do LDAP authentication in JIRA in an interesting way.

the idea is to use LDAP "lazily".  Here's the text of a message to jira-user that describes the basic idea:

====================
the way we chose to manage this was to leave "external user
management" OFF, and to write a custom "credentials provider" that
worked the way we wanted.

it was not completely simple, because of how the osuser framework
works, but we managed to more or less get it working the way we
wanted.

our LDAP credentials provider contains a reference to an "underlying"
OfBiz (standard) credentials provider.  it works by first
authenticating the user against LDAP, then:

 if the authentication was successful
  if the user exists in the underlying provider
    succeed
  else
    create the user in the underlying provider, using info from LDAP,
    and succeed
 else 
  if the user exists in the underlying provider
    if we can authenticate the user in the underlying provider
      succeed
  else
    fail

this means that users are created in JIRA's database on-demand.  it
also means that if our LDAP goes down, people with existing JIRA
accounts can still login to JIRA, using their passwords in the
underlying provider.  which is nice since we use JIRA (among other
things) to report system/network problems with things like LDAP
servers.

one problem (and here my memory fails a bit, so I might get some
details wrong) is that we still can't use JIRA's Add User feature
directly.  There should be no reason why this wouldn't work, but a
quirk in the OSUser framework prevents it.  Basically (again, IIRC)
there is a "handles" method that providers need to implement, and
this method is called with the username before any other methods
(authenticate, create, etc.) are called.  When adding a user (this is
assuming we're using the same uid as in LDAP) the framework first
checks if our provider handles that UID.  since it does (the uid
already exists in LDAP) it doesn't make sense to create it, so the
Add User fails, even though the user doesn't exist in the underlying
provider.

this isn't a big deal, usually, since people can just login on their
own and everything will be created for them.  the only problem is if
you (the admin) wanted to create a user and add them to some groups.

to get around this, we also wrote a "backdoor" action, accessible
from the web but not part of JIRA's main interface, that can
manipulate the ofbiz database more or less directly.  we use this if
we need to add new users to specific groups.

====================
fields.summary: LDAP authentication

fields.description:
If you are setting up ViewCVS integration for a CVS repository and your ViewCVS has multiple cvsroots, Jira asks you to supply a 'root' parameter.  This parameter is later passed to ViewCVS on the command line like:

http://viewcvspath/viewcvs.cgi/path?root=whatever

In viewcvs 0.92 at least, the parameter looks like it should be 'cvsroot' and not 'root'.

This was implemeted to fix JRA-3193, and the comments there indicate 'cvsroot' but the implementation appears to be 'root' instead.  Even the description text where you provide the value of your cvsroot incorrectly describes the parameter as 'root'.
fields.summary: ViewCVS integration passing incorrect parameter

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

There is [add-on for JIRA Server available on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.redmoon.jira.documentvault/server/overview] that may help resolve this request. However, for fine-grained security for files, we recommend keeping attachments in a dedicated document or file management application.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

fields.description:
Over in Apache-land, there are certain administrative processes, like setting up a new committer's accounts, or creating a top-level project.  For these, certain details must be captured. Eg for a new committer, one needs to know their preferred userid, email, CVS module karma required,  vote URL and have a signed CLA.

Once JIRA has per-project per-type custom fields, all this data could be stored in a JIRA issue.  It would then be nice if one could upload:
 - a custom HTML interface for the issue entry form
 - a custom "view" of the issue, specified as a template in some language (velocity, wiki etc).

This would be useful in many contexts, eg. for entering support requests. In these environments, JIRA would then effectively become an invisible back-end system. Issue entry and viewing could be completely integrated into a company's existing website.
fields.summary: Multiple user-definable templates for creating and viewing issues

fields.description:
Scenario:
1. I create a search to find some issues
2. then I want to update some if them with links
3. I open an issue and need to find another one to link with
4. For this I need to run another search and I do it in a new browser window/tab.
When I return to my original search and click ither 'view' button or next search result page, I get another search request executed (the second one that I carried to search link-issue).

Looks like I can only have one 'active' filter in session.
Would be usefull to allow having more that one.
fields.summary: Allow having more that one 'active' filter in session

fields.description:
If the Navigator displays only one item, the "Return to search" box displays the word "Next" despite localisation has been turned on. See screenshot.

This is important to fix because the error is in a higly visible place.

fields.description:
Hi
We are migrating from Jira 2.0.2 to 2.6.1 Enterprise version
The database we have chosen is MS SQLserver since Oracle was not compatiable to us. We had lots of issues beyond 4000 characters in the comments and description field and we would like to have them too.
We are in the testing phase of this migration. The data import was succesdfull withoutr any big issues.
Request you to tell us what changes we need to make in the fieldtype-mssql.xml file
fields.summary: MS SQL Server Migration

fields.description:
Issues imported from Bugzilla have the same update date&time equal to the time import is performed -- thus update date&time from Bugzilla is not preserved for the issues as imported to Jira.

It seems a side-effect of Bugzilla Import Key field changed from original bug number from Bugzilla to some large number, which alone is a bit weird: what is the field changed for?..
fields.summary: update date is not preserved from Zilla issues

fields.description:
Bugzilla has a built-in field for URL. Looks like it is not imported by JIRA 2.6.1. Not convenient if the field was used in Bugzilla.

Seems reasonable to include URL to the end of description, if not creating a separate field in JIRA.
fields.summary: URLs from Bugzilla are not imported

fields.description:
We've just created a blank database and imported several products from Bugzilla.

I found at least 2 issues where no description was imported; most of descriptions were imported successfully.

Issues where descriptions are not imported are consistent for several import attempts; previous attempts were taken before creating a new database. Looks like it's issue contents that leads to the problem.

Any suggestions on giving you more details maybe?
fields.summary: description from Bugzilla is lost for some issues

fields.description:
Page:  /LinkExistingIssuedefault.jspa

1.  Click "Link" link on any issue
2.  See the "Link Issue" page, note that the Issue field is too narrow to contain the ID of most bugs.  It can display only about ten capital letters without making the user have to click in it and navigate to the right to see the rest of what has been pasted there (via the "select issue" feature, for example).  

It looks like there is plenty of horizontal space available to widen this field.
fields.summary: Link Issue:  the Issue field is too narrow

fields.description:
It would be great if you can enter time to a greater level of precision.
For example you are unable to enter 2.5d you must enter 2d 4h.
fields.summary: Logging Work Done - Can't enter 2.5d

fields.description: In JIRA's CVS integration, fetching the CVS log ('cvs log' on a checked-out repository) and parsing the log are one task.  We should rather split these operations, so the log parser reads the logs from a file (generated by a JIRA service, or copied from a secure server periodically in a cron job).
fields.summary: Separate CVS log retrieval from log parsing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3870].
  {panel}

Say I wish to search for part of a string, like "BasicCommand.java:150" in:

org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.command.BasicCommand.getFileEndingWith(BasicCommand.java:150)

I should just be able to enter "BasicCommand.java:150" into the search box, just like in grep, mutt and every other sensible search system. In JIRA this doesn't work, because "word" searches are the default. I would need to append "*" to the query.  I think the "*" should be implicit.  If an individual word is really required, it specified with \<...\> or something.

(Of course I'd also need to add "*" to the beginning of the term, which Lucene doesn't allow... JIRA's search is broken on many levels).
fields.summary: Searching for "foo" should match all issues containing "foo"

fields.description:
Seems like if the file has been removed from the repository, but still appears in the cvs log, statcvs tries to get the number of lines for the file and fails, as the file is not in the checked out copy of the repository.

The functionality of CVS integration is not implacted - the commits are still shown. However, the logged warnings are annoying.

Possible workaround might be to decrease the log level for statcvs to ERROR in log4j.properties:
log4j.category.net.sf.statcvs = ERROR, console
fields.summary: Statcvs produces warnings about missing files if the files have been deleted from the repository

fields.description:
The following exception occurs during automated backup, leaving an aborted file.  No mail is being delivered -- assume this is the result of same.

How do we go about finding and cleaning the abberant data?

thanks.
